questions.question: Edmund was a traitor at the beginning of the story, How did he show he had changed?

choices.answer: He fought bravely for Aslan
He apologized to the Professor
He killed the White Witch
He rescued Mr. and Mrs. Beaver

questions.question: What was the climax of this story?

choices.answer: The rescue of Lucy's friend, Mr. Tumnus
The great battle, when Aslan kills the White Witch
The crowning of Peter as the High King at Cair Paravel
The unexpected arrival of Father Christmas

questions.question: What is the main problem in this story?

choices.answer: getting back through the wardrobe
defeating the White Witch
hiding from Mrs. Macready
saving Father Christmas

questions.question: Most of the story takes place in

choices.answer: a professor's house
a magical land reached by accident
the far north where it is cold and snowy
the countryside near London, England

questions.question: The main theme of this story centers around the conflict of

choices.answer: male versus female
man versus animal
good versus evil
fantasy versus reality

questions.question: What kind of story is The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe?

choices.answer: fantasy
realistic fiction
non fiction
mystery

questions.question: What signals a change in the general mood of the story from sadness to joy?

choices.answer: the sharing of the Turkish Delight
Lucy's return from Narnia
Edmund's discovery of the White Witch's house
the melting of the snow

questions.question: Just before Aslan goes to the Stone Table to join the White Witch, the mood of the story is

choices.answer: joyful
sorrowful
exciting
relaxing

questions.question: In this story, which of these is an example of fantasy?

choices.answer: The Professor believed the children's story
Edmund pretended not to believe Lucy after he went to Narnia
Lucy met a faun, a half man half goat creature
The children hid from Mrs. Macready

questions.question: Which of these best describes Aslan?

choices.answer: He was very gentle and never became angry
He was both wonderful and terrible
He was very kind but shy
He was very unfriendly to everyone

questions.question: After Lucy's first trip through the wardrobe, how did Edmund treat her?

choices.answer: He felt sorry for her.
He protected her
He was very kind to her
He was mean to her.

questions.question: The antagonist in a story is the one who causes the problem.  The antagonist in this story is

choices.answer: Mrs. Macready
The White Witch
Aslan
Mr. Tumnus

questions.question: The four children hand been sent away from London because-

choices.answer: of the spell of the White Witch
of the air raids during the war
they kept talking about Narnia
it had become so cold in London

questions.question: The author assumes that, before reading the story, the reader knows-

choices.answer: the story of Adam and Eve
Who the White Witch is
where Aslan came from
the purpose of the Stone Table

questions.question: How does the author tie the beginning of the story to the end?

choices.answer: The Professor goes with the children to Narnia
The children come back from Narnia the same time they left.
Mrs. Macready and the Witch turn out to be the same person
Aslan is the first and last character seen in the story

questions.question: What was different about spring in the Narnia and spring in the real world?

choices.answer: In the real world, flowers bloom
In Narnia, fruits and veggies are harvested
In the real world, spring happens after winter
In Narnia, spring happened in only a few hours.

questions.question: Even though the children are in Narnia for many years-

choices.answer: Aslan agrees to meet them in the real world
no time has passed in the real world
Mrs. Macready and the professor are younger when they return
they never grow up in Narnia

questions.question: How do we know that the children are honest and know right from wrong?

choices.answer: They agree to let the White Witch stand trial for her crimes
They tell the professor why some of his coats are missing.
They all accept gifts that Father Christmas presents to them
They immediately tell Edmund about Aslan's sacrafice for him

questions.question: When Peter and Susan talk to the Professor about Lucy, he-

choices.answer: wants to send them back to their parents
seems to believe that Lucy might have found Narnia
thinks they are very dishonest
tells them that Lucy's story is true since he has been there

questions.question: How did everyone know the powers of the White Witch were weakening?

choices.answer: The stone statue came back to life
the children were able to enter Narnia
Mr. Tumnus became Lucy's friend
Winter was turning to spring

questions.question: What did Edmund do to the stone lion in the White Witch's courtyard?

choices.answer: He told the lion where to find Aslan
He rode on the lion to escape the witch
He drew a moustache and glasses on it
he turned the lion from stone to a real lion

questions.question: Why didn't Edmund enjoy his meal at the Beaver's house?

choices.answer: He was thinking about Turkish Delight
He missed the Professor's house and the real world
He wanted to hurry and find Aslan
He was afraid of the White Witch

questions.question: Many of the creatures in Narnia called the children-

choices.answer: They Who Came through the Wardrobe
Sons of Adam and Daughters of Eve
Defenders of Narnia
Friends of Aslan and Foes of the Witch

questions.question: Near the end of the story, why did Aslan become sad?

choices.answer: He wanted to leave Narnia
He was disappointed in the children
He knew he was going to die
He didn't want to fight the Witch

questions.question: What did Aslan say that showed he had forgiven Edmund?

choices.answer: "it is the Witch who is to blame for his wrongdoing."
"there is no need to talk to him about what is past."
"No, Sons of Adam before animals."
"Must more people die for Edmund?"

questions.question: When did Lucy meet Mr. Tumnus?

choices.answer: right after she went through the wardrobe for the first time
at the same time she met Mr. & Mrs. Beaver
at the same time she first met Aslan
right before the children arrived to stay at the Professors

questions.question: Which of these happened last?

choices.answer: The snow started to melt
Peter killed the wolf
Edmund found the White Witch
Aslan made Peter a Knight

questions.question: Turkish Delight is most likely a kind of -

choices.answer: gourmet meat
intoxicating wine
candy
jam

questions.question: What did Peter mean by "We've fallen on our feet." when they arrived at the Professor's house?

choices.answer: The Professor's house seemed to be magical
The Professor's house wasn't very nice
Mrs. Macready and the Professor didn't seem to like children
They were going to have a good time there

questions.question: What does the expression "always winter and never Christmas" mean?

choices.answer: Aslan would never be able to melt the ice and snow
The White Witch would give them Christmas presents
Narnia was always cold, and it was not a happy place
Father Christmas would never come to them if they were bad

questions.question: What did the White Witch say to Edmund to convince him to come to her house?

choices.answer: "I would make you forget all about them."
"I would see to it that you got the chance to meet Aslan"
"look for those two hills and walk through the wood"
"I'd be able to give you some more Turkish Delight"

questions.question: Which of these explains why the White Witch was interested in the children?

choices.answer: She wants to turn all the children into evil creatures
She thinks the children know how to make spring appear
She believes that human children will destroy her
She knows the children can summon Aslan to Narnia
